meanings.sent1: She kept misordering the books on the shelf, putting them in random places.
meanings.sent2: Please do not misorder the steps when assembling the furniture.
meanings.sent3: The misordering of the ingredients in the recipe led to a strange-tasting dish.
meanings.sent4: His misordering of priorities caused chaos in the project timeline.
meanings.sent5: The misordering of the alphabet made it difficult to find the right book.

meanings.definition: Disorder or confusion in the arrangement of things.
meanings.sent1: The misordering of the files made it hard to find the important documents.
meanings.sent2: There was a noticeable misordering of the seating arrangement at the event.
meanings.sent3: The misordering of the colors in the painting gave it a unique, abstract look.
meanings.sent4: The misordering of the traffic lights caused a lot of confusion at the intersection.
meanings.sent5: The misordering of the pages in the book made it challenging to follow the story.
